intro: Eriogonum mearnsii, commonly known as Mearns' buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum mearnsii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in chaparral and sagebrush ecosystems.
